intro: Fleischmannia altihuanucana, commonly known as the Huancavelica lily, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of Peru. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces a single stem that bears multiple flower buds. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
